output.markdown_report:
**Cost of base rate report**: $0.56

### Results
- Chances of A new country achieves a successful soft landing on the moon: 0.0233% per day for days in the date range (Using this rate we can extrapolate to 0.7% per month, 8.14% per year)
- Numerator Size: 5 Times a new country achieved a successful soft landing on the moon between Jan 1, 1966 and Nov 6, 2024
- Denominator Size: 21494 Days between Jan 01, 1966 and Nov 06, 2024
- Date Range: Jan 01, 1966 to Nov 06, 2024 | 21494 days, 716.47 months, 58.89 years

### Background Information
As of 2024, four countries have successfully achieved a soft landing on the Moon: the United States, the former Soviet Union, China, and India. India became the fourth country to achieve this feat with its Chandrayaan-3 mission, which successfully landed on the Moon on August 23, 2023 \[[2](https://www.space.com/india-chandrayaan-3-moon-landing-success#:~:text=%22This%20success%20belongs%20to%20all,the%20spacecraft%20and%20mission%20control.)\]\[[7](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-66425524#:~:text=Chandrayaan%2D3%27s%20lander%20and%20rover%20are,Chandrayaan%2D3%20was%20in%20good%20%22health%22.)\]\[[11](https://www.bbc.com/news/world-asia-india-66601996#:~:text=%22%2C%20the%20space%20agency%20said.,in%20the%20Vikram%20lander%27s%20belly.)\]. Prior to India's achievement, the last new country to join this list was China, which accomplished its first successful soft landing on the Moon in 2013 with the Chang'e 3 mission.

Given this information, the rate at which new countries have joined the list of those achieving a successful soft landing on the Moon is relatively low. Over the past 60 years, since the first successful soft landing by the Soviet Union in 1966, only four countries have achieved this, averaging approximately one new country every 15 years.

output.markdown_report:
**Cost of base rate report**: $1.10

### Results
- Chances of Time Magazine's Person of the Year is something other than an individual person: 33.3333% per Time Magazine selects a Person of the Year
- Numerator Size: 3 Times that Time Magazine's Person of the Year was something other than an individual person between Jan 1, 2012 and Dec 31, 2021
- Denominator Size: 9 Times that Time Magazine selected a Person of the Year between Jan 1, 2012 and Dec 31, 2021
- Date Range: Jan 01, 2012 to Dec 31, 2021 | 3652 days, 121.73 months, 10.01 years

### Background Information
Between 2012 and 2021, Time Magazine's Person of the Year was awarded to something other than an individual person twice. In 2018, "The Guardians," a group of journalists who faced persecution, arrest, or murder for their reporting, were collectively named Person of the Year. This group included individuals like Jamal Khashoggi, but the award was given to them as a collective entity representing the broader struggle for truth in journalism. In 2014, the Ebola fighters, a group of healthcare workers and volunteers who combated the Ebola virus outbreak in West Africa, were collectively recognized as Person of the Year. These selections reflect Time's occasional choice to highlight significant groups or movements rather than a single individual \[[5](https://time.com/6342816/person-of-the-year-2023-taylor-swift-choice/#:~:text=As%20a%20tradition%2C%20Person%20of,or%20a%20titan%20of%20industry.)\].
